description.narrative: The project aims to contribute to meeting immediate and longer term food security and livelihood needs of evacuees following repatriation to Ambae Island. Through partners active on Ambae, Oxfam will support up to 2300 individuals with agricultural production via the distribution of fast-growing vegetable seeds, planting materials and agricultural training information, and will replenish pre-positioned NFI stock in preparation for the cyclone season. These activities will result in improved food security and nutrition, reduced dependency on aid, and diversified livelihoods, as well as lifting preparedness ahead of the cyclone season.

mailing-address.narrative: 132 Leicester street, Carlton South VIC 3053, Australia
